text: Why do you need serverless for this, you could achieve all this with provided HubL functions or if you'd prefer pass HubL data to a js_partial and use react for the client side filter, would be way faster as welll
Also since your using tailwind how do you even make sure that the right classes get generated when you pass the styled html back from the server

1. Why do we need serverless? 
    a. The filters: years, partners, location, live in a custom module. And therefore their values lives in the 'widgets' part of the blog. 
    b. Maybe I missed something, what hubl functions could we use to filter based on data living in 'widgets' part of the blog? 
    c. If we use js_partial, we need to set up a project for the React part. We don't use them yet. 
2. Generating tailwind classes? 
    a. The serverless files lives inside the theme.

aha yeah I think i see what you mean but this could still be solved with client side js. If you have your own module for the filters that module can still manipulate the elements of the other module on the same page with js.
But this is then a different issue, no idea why the srcset attribute isn't passing down properly. Might be a syntax issue?
So, I need to return actually the whole blogs to the client and modify it with js right?
You can render the blogs by HubL functions
If you don't know where to start a really good base is the free atlas theme blog template. the guy who made that did a really good job imo

I see what you mean. On first load, retrieve the entire posts. The `blog_recent_posts`
limits it to 200 though, but I guess that's ok since we don't think we have more than that.

Yeah and then just use clientside js for the filters. I prefer using react when it comes to filters as its just a cleaner look with state but if you don't want to set that up you can do it with regular js
You can have it be part of the same module or extrapolate the filters into a seperate one

Hello,  I have created my first serverless function, however the logs are not populating. I can see the API calls are being made successfully, but none of my console.log statements are coming out.

When I try "hs logs" with the endpoint, I get an error that no logs were found. Similarly, when I try hs functions ls, I get no functions found.

Can someone please help?
